titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Adriana Voorhees Magaw probate 1977.545
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:13:51 +0000.

did.abstract: Probate of the last will and testament of Adriana Voorhees Magaw, dated June 16, 1831.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Adriana Voorhees Magaw (1795-1831) was a resident of Gravesend, Kings County and married Van Brunt Magaw (1783-1831) on November 2, 1811 in the Reformed Dutch Church of Flatbush. Their first child, Mary Elizabeth Magaw, was born on October 5, 1812, and they had three more daughters and three sons.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Adriana Voorhees Magaw probate, 1977.545, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Probate of the last will and testament of Adriana Voorhees Magaw, dated June 16, 1831.
